title: Curry torches Spurs again, ties MJ with latest 40
content: Two days after he lit up the Spurs for 46 points, Warriors star Stephen Curry scored 49 to beat them Friday night, tying Michael Jordan's record for most 40-point games after turning 30 in the process.

title: After 6 ejected, WVU women upset No. 15 Duke
content: Down to just five players after six Mountaineers were ejected before the half, West Virginia managed to grind out a 57-49 upset of No. 15 Duke on Friday night.

title: Pistons top 76ers without stars for 9th straight win
content: The East-leading Detroit Pistons extended their win streak to nine games, their longest since 2007-08, with a 114-105 win over the Philadelphia 76ers Friday night.

title: Boozer's 35 points tie 2nd most by Duke freshman
content: Cameron Boozer scored 35 points in Friday's 100-62 victory over Indiana State, tying the second-most points in a game for a Duke freshman behind only Cooper Flagg's 42 last season.

title: Belichick dispels Giants talk, reaffirms UNC focus
content: North Carolina coach Bill Belichick said Friday he will not pursue any NFL head coaching vacancies after his name surfaced in connection with the vacant New York Giants job.

title: Thomas has back surgery, to miss PGA Tour start
content: Two-time major winner Justin Thomas announced Friday that he will miss the beginning of the 2026 PGA Tour season after undergoing back surgery.

title: Disney reaches new deal with YouTube TV
content: Disney and YouTube TV reached a new deal to bring channels such as ABC and ESPN back to the Google-owned live-streaming platform Friday, ending a blackout for customers that lasted over two weeks.

title: 'Last Chance U' coach Beam dies after being shot
content: College football coach John Beam, who was featured in the Netflix series "Last Chance U," has died after being shot, the Oakland Police Department said Friday.

title: üçå Bradley Jr. No. 1 pick in Banana Ball draft
content: The Indianapolis Clowns selected Bradley at No. 1 as part of the inaugural Banana Ball draft Thursday night.

content: Cristiano Ronaldo was shown a red card against the Republic of Ireland after appearing to elbow Dara O'Shea.

content: The NASCAR Cup Series isn't kind to rookies, no matter how highly touted, but that may not apply to Connor Zilisch when he steps up in 2026.

content: The hip-hop icon will be advising his hometown team on talent selection and halftime production of the show.

content: Steve Alexander highlights fantasy basketball names trending upwards or downwards, with key takeaways for each.

title: How Roldan went from USMNT afterthought to Pochettino favorite
content: A few months ago, Cristian Roldan believed his USMNT career was drifting away. Now he could be in line for a key role under Mauricio Pochettino.

title: Ranked: Europe's 10 worst transfers from this summer -- and the 5 best
content: After three months, we rank the 10 worst transfers and the 5 best from the summer of 2025 in the Premier League, LaLiga and the rest of Europe.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United want to sign Wolves' Jo√£o Gomes
content: Wolverhampton Wanderers midfielder Jo√£o Gomes is a target for Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Kannada Film Actor Alleges Stalking, Harassment By Businessman She Met In 2022
content: According to the complaint submitted to the police on October 17, the actress had met the businessman, identified as Aravind Venkatesh Reddy, during an event in Sri Lanka.

title: 'No Sorrow In Defeat, No Arrogance In Victory': RJD After Bihar Poll Defeat
content: The Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) on Saturday said that the ups and downs are "inevitable" in the "endless journey of public service", a day after it faced one of its worst setbacks in the Bihar assembly elections.

title: Delhi Blast Woman Suspect Wanted To Flee, Had Applied For Passport: Sources
content: One of the terror suspects arrested in connection with the 10/11 Delhi blast was likely preparing to flee the country, with sources pointing out that she had recently applied for a passport.

title: BJP Begins Action Against Bihar Rebels Day After Result, Suspends Ex-Minister
content: Former Union Minister RK Singh has been suspended by the BJP over anti-party activities, days after the senior leader questioned the NDA leadership and raised serious allegations against the Bihar government.

title: "Speculation Unnecessary": J&K Top Cop Says Blast In Nowgam "Accidental"
content: The Jammu and Kashmir Director General of Police (DGP), Nalin Prabhat, stressed on Saturday that any speculation about the incident was unnecessary, as preliminary findings pointed to an inadvertent blast during a mandated forensic procedure.

title: Cops Detain 2 More Doctors from Al Falah University Known To Umar Nabi
content: Delhi Police have detained three persons, including two doctors from Haryana's Al Falah University who were known to Dr Umar Nabi, the driver of the car that exploded near the Red Fort, officials said on Saturday.

title: Surgeon With Previous Link To Al Falah University Detained In Punjab
content: Investigating agencies have detained a doctor from Punjab's Pathankot for questioning in connection with the Delhi blast earlier this week, police sources said on Saturday.

title: Delhi Blast Updates: Two Gates Of Red Fort Metro Station Reopen Days After Explosion
content: Thirteen people were killed and many others injured after a car driven by a doctor at Al-Falah University exploded near the Red Fort Metro Station on Monday.

title: Navi Mumbai Airport To Begin Commercial Flights On Christmas
content: Mumbai's second airport, Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA), inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi earlier, will begin commercial operations soon.

title: Bihar Election Results 2025 LIVE: "Achieved Position My Father Envisioned," Says Chirag Paswan After NDA Win
content: The National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in Bihar has registered¬†a thumping victory and Chief Minister Nitish Kumar is set for a fifth consecutive term, as the coalition won 202 of the 243 seats in the state.¬†

title: US Firm Claims It Foiled Large-Scale AI Cyberattack By Chinese Hackers
content: Anthropic, the maker of the artificial intelligence (AI) chatbot Claude, said it has thwarted what can be described as "the first documented case of a large-scale AI cyberattack executed without substantial human intervention."

title: Gurugram Man Survives Fall After Bungee Jumping Goes Wrong In Rishikesh
content: A video of the incident has gone viral. It shows the man writhing in pain on the tin sheet as the broken rope dangles above him.

title: India's Veiled Dig Over Pak Heading UN Panel On Sanctions Against Taliban
content: India has criticised Pakistan heading the Security Council's committee on sanctions against the Taliban and co-chairing the counter-terrorism panel, citing conflicts of interest.

title: UK To Overhaul Asylum System, Allow Refugees To Stay For Limited Time
content: Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood will on Monday unveil sweeping changes to the UK asylum system, including Danish-style proposals to limit the time refugees can stay in the country, according to sources with knowledge of the plans.

title: "All She Does Is Complain, Complain": Trump Withdraws Support For Key Ally
content: US President Donald Trump said Friday he was pulling his endorsement for key ally Marjorie Taylor Greene after a string of disagreements, calling the hard-right lawmaker a "ranting lunatic."

title: Ayodhya Ram Temple To Hoist Flag On November 25, PM Modi To Attend: Trust
content: Ayodhya is preparing for one of its most significant religious events as the Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra Trust announced that the traditional sacred day of Lord Ram's wedding will witness the ceremonial flag hoisting

title: Odd One Out: 24 Of 25 Bihar Ministers Retain Seats In Assembly Elections
content: As the ruling NDA decimated the Mahagathbandhan in Bihar to retain power, all but one of the 25 state ministers in the fray won their respective seats.

title: Cops Trace Vehicles Near i20 That Exploded Near Red Fort, Quizzes Drivers
content: In a bid to piece together the precise sequence of events before the blast near Red Fort, the investigators have prepared a detailed list of each vehicle that entered the nearby parking area where the exploded car was stationed for three hours

title: Karnataka Man Mixes Poison In Neighbour's Food To Avenge Years-Old Feud
content: Investigators initially found a bottle of pesticide at the home, but during further questioning, the accused revealed that they had used the toxic Datura plant to contaminate the 'sambar' served at lunch.

title: 'Ups and downs inevitable': RJD's first reaction after Bihar defeat; calls itself 'party of poor'
content: The Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) has reacted to its significant defeat in the Bihar assembly elections, stating it is not despondent despite a crushing loss to the ruling NDA. The party emphasized that public service is an ongoing journey with inevitable ups and downs, vowing to continue raising the voice of the poor.

title: 'I commend Mohsin Naqvi': Shehbaz Sharif congratulates Pakistan team; gets trolled
content: Babar Azam's unbeaten 102 guided Pakistan to an eight-wicket victory over Sri Lanka, securing the ODI series 2-0. The win drew praise from Pakistan's Prime Minister, but drew a critical response from former Indian cricketer Aakash Chopra regarding the significance of the bilateral series win.

title: Mira Murati‚Äôs AI startup eyes $50B: Funding talks begin; valuation may soar higher
content: Thinking Machines Lab, founded by former OpenAI executive Mira Murati, is reportedly in early discussions to raise new funding at a valuation of around $50 billion. This would significantly increase its valuation from July and place it among the most valuable private companies.

title: Trump‚Äôs tariffs cut US toy orders by 50%; how are Indian exporters fighting back
content: Indian toy exporters face a significant slowdown as US buyers divert orders to other nations following a 50% tariff imposition. Despite a strong start to the financial year, new orders for the upcoming festive season have plummeted by half.

title: 'Explosive samples were being forwarded‚Ä¶': Govt calls Nowgam blast accidental ‚Äî what MHA said
content: An accidental explosion at Nowgam Police Station in Srinagar killed nine people and injured 27 others. The blast occurred while processing a large cache of explosive substances and chemicals recovered during a terror module investigation. The ministry of home affairs has ruled out any terror angle, attributing the incident to the unstable nature of the seized materials.

title: Infosys hands out Sept quarter bonus: Employees to get 75% average bonus; check details
content: Infosys has announced performance-linked payouts for the September quarter, with employees receiving an average bonus of 75% of their eligible amount. This figure is slightly lower than the previous quarter's average of 80%. Payouts varied by job level and performance rating, with bonuses ranging from 70.5% to 83% and will be added to November salaries.

title: Oracle stock down: Gains, that helped founder beat Musk briefly, erased
content: Oracle founder Larry Ellison briefly surpassed Elon Musk in wealth after a massive OpenAI deal boosted Oracle's stock. However, the gains have evaporated, with Oracle's value plummeting recently. Musk has since reclaimed his top spot, driven by strong performances from Tesla and SpaceX, showcasing the volatile nature of tech billionaire rankings.

title: Bihar: 5 dead as fire breaks out in Muzaffarpur; short circuit suspected as cause
content: A devastating fire in Muzaffarpur's Motipur Nagar Parishad area on Friday night claimed the lives of five individuals from the same family. Five others sustained serious injuries and are currently undergoing treatment. Firefighting operations are ongoing, with preliminary reports indicating a short circuit as the probable cause of the blaze.

title: ‚ÄòEkdum dhaga khol diya‚Äô: Vaibhav hits 144 runs in 42 balls
content: As Bihar celebrated Nitish Kumar‚Äôs landslide win, thousands of kilometres away, Vaibhav Sooryavanshi delivered his own fireworks, smashing 15 sixes and registering the joint second-fastest T20 hundred by an Indian. Already an IPL record-breaker, the Samastipur sensation is drawing praise from coaches who see him as Bihar‚Äôs MS Dhoni-like beacon.

title: GM to suppliers: Find alternatives to China; America‚Äôs largest carmaker sets deadline
content: General Motors is directing thousands of suppliers to remove China-sourced parts and raw materials from their supply chains, aiming for complete divestment by 2027. This move, intensified by deepening U.S.-China trade hostilities and President Trump's policies, seeks to enhance supply chain resiliency. Carmakers are accelerating efforts to unwind decades-old sourcing ties due to ongoing geopolitical and economic wrangling.

title: What does the colour of your urine say about your health
content: Your urine's colour offers vital health clues, from pale yellow indicating good hydration to darker shades suggesting dehydration. Unusual hues like red, brown, or even blue-green can signal infections, liver issues, or rare conditions. Even foamy or cloudy urine warrants attention. Observing these changes can prompt timely medical checks and aid personal wellness.

title: Putting 2020 behind? Chirag Paswan meets Nitish Kumar after NDA‚Äôs big Bihar win
content: Chirag Paswan met Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, congratulating him on NDA's sweeping victory in the assembly elections and refuting speculation of a rift between their parties. Paswan highlighted the CM's appreciation for all alliance partners, emphasising their collaborative success in the polls.

title: Delhi car blast: CCTV footage captures impact of explosion inside Lal Quila metro station ‚Äî watch
content: CCTV footage from Lal Quila Metro Station shows commuters panicking during the car blast near the Red Fort. Delhi Police are intensifying digital surveillance and have filed a fresh FIR to investigate a "deeper conspiracy" behind the attack, with initial reports suggesting military-grade explosives may have been used.

title: When four wheels become weapons: Delhi‚Äôs 1st suicide car bombing exposes new threat ‚Äî why cops should worry
content: Delhi faces its first Suicide Vehicle-Borne Improvised Explosive Device (SVBIED) attack, a deadly tactic where vehicle parts become lethal projectiles.  These blasts are hard to prevent due to civilian vehicle camouflage and bomber commitment.  Intelligence, public vigilance, and physical barriers are crucial for future prevention.

title: Was WhistlinDiesel arrested? Reported tax-evasion leak sparks online buzz
content: Popular YouTuber Cody Shane Detwiler, also known as WhistlinDiesel, faced arrest on November 13, 2025. Reports indicate tax evasion charges in Williamson County, Tennessee. A substantial bond was set. Detwiler himself confirmed the arrest via social media. This news has sparked widespread online discussion among his followers and the wider internet community.

title: Is Giannis Antetokounmpo playing tonight vs Hornets? Latest Bucks injury update
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo is probable to play tonight against the Charlotte Hornets after resting the previous game due to left knee patellar tendinopathy. The persistent condition requires careful load management, but his recent dominant performance highlights his continued impact. His return is crucial for the Bucks, who are also dealing with other roster injuries.

title: Gabrielle Union shares emotional birthday tribute for sister Tracy
content: Gabrielle Union recently celebrated her sister Tracy's birthday with a touching Instagram post featuring cherished childhood photos. The heartwarming tribute, which also saw tributes from Dwyane Wade and daughter Kaavia James, has captivated fans. This follows Union's equally emotional birthday message for Kaavia, highlighting the actress's deep family connections.

title: Dharmendra to celebrate his 90th birthday next month as family plans double celebration
content: Iconic star Dharmendra is on the mend after his recent hospital stay and is gearing up for a milestone 90th birthday bash this December. His beloved wife, Hema Malini, reassures fans that he‚Äôs in good spirits. Close friend Salman Khan has been a constant source of support, visiting him in the hospital and expressing heartfelt wishes for his speedy recovery.

title: Punjab woman who visited Pakistan as part of Sikh pilgrimage group goes missing
content: A woman pilgrim from Punjab, Sarbjit Kaur, has not returned to India after participating in Guru Nanak Dev's birth anniversary celebrations in Pakistan. She was part of a large Sikh group that visited various shrines. Pakistani immigration authorities have informed their Indian counterparts about the incident.

title: ‚Äò10Dulkar‚Äô of Bihar: Nitish set for 10th oath as CM; how he rode on a wave of pro-incumbency
content: Nitish Kumar has secured a decisive victory in the Bihar assembly polls, defying expectations and demonstrating his enduring appeal. His ability to consolidate support across diverse caste groups, coupled with a focus on governance and development, propelled the JDU-led NDA to a landslide win, marking his tenth term as Chief Minister.

title: IPL: From RR to CSK! How big a pay cut did Jadeja take to join?
content: Ravindra Jadeja has officially moved to Rajasthan Royals from Chennai Super Kings in a major IPL trade. After 12 seasons with CSK, the all-rounder accepts a reduced salary at RR, marking a homecoming to the team where he began his IPL career. This significant deal also sees Sanju Samson move to CSK and Sam Curran join the Royals.

title: Delhi car blast case: Terror accused Dr Shaheen applied for passport; planned to flee Dubai
content: A doctor from Al-Falah University, Dr. Shaheen Shahid, was arrested for her alleged role in a terror plot, attempting to flee to Dubai. Her involvement surfaced after a colleague's arrest and the recovery of an assault rifle from her car. The module, targeting students and doctors, was dismantled through arrests across multiple locations.

title: India-Canada trade: Goyal says 'all possibilities are on the table' ‚Äî FTA talks to resume?
content: India is exploring all options to resume free trade agreement negotiations with Canada. Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal held recent discussions with his Canadian counterpart, Maninder Sidhu. These engagements aim to boost bilateral cooperation and strategic partnership. Trade figures show a rise in Indian exports to Canada. The diplomatic relationship is gaining momentum after recent high-level meetings.

title: Historic! Pant surpasses legendary Sehwag; sets new record for India
content: Rishabh Pant has etched his name in Test cricket history, surpassing Virender Sehwag to become India's leading six-hitter. His aggressive batting propelled India to a strong position after Jasprit Bumrah's exceptional bowling performance saw South Africa dismissed for a low score.  Pant's record-breaking six underscored his fearless approach, vital for India's chase.

title: Bank holiday today: Are banks open or closed on November 15? Check details
content: Banks nationwide, except in Jharkhand, will be open today, November 15th, as it is the third Saturday of the month. Customers in Jharkhand will find banks closed due to the Birsa Munda Birth Anniversary. This differs from the usual closure on second and fourth Saturdays, with mobile and net banking remaining accessible.

title: J&K: CCTV footage captures moment massive blast hit J&K police station; 7 killed
content: An accidental explosion at a Srinagar police station killed four and injured 27, mostly police and forensic personnel, while examining explosives from a 'white-collar' terror module. The blast occurred during sample extraction from 360 kg of materials seized from an arrested doctor's residence, damaging the police station.

title: NCW seeks strict POSH compliance; UGC tells colleges to submit reports and step up training
content: The National Commission for Women has called for stricter enforcement of the POSH Act in Higher Educational Institutions, urging stronger redressal systems and comprehensive training. Following the directive, the UGC has asked HEIs to submit updated compliance reports and take part in NCW‚Äôs Campus Calling Programme, which includes 800 nationwide sessions on legal literacy, safety, and gender sensitisation.

title: IPL: 'Gave me my first platform' ‚Äì Jadeja reveals why his reunion with Royals is special
content: Ravindra Jadeja and Sam Curran have been traded to Rajasthan Royals from Chennai Super Kings, with Jadeja returning to his former franchise. Sanju Samson moves to CSK in a significant player trade, ending his 11-year stint with RR. Nitish Rana is traded to Delhi Capitals, while Donovan Ferreira returns to RR.

title: Grocery bills ease for Americans! Trump cuts tariffs on key food items - what are they?
content: US President Trump has eased tariffs on various food items like beef, coffee, and fruits, signaling a policy shift to combat rising consumer costs. This move follows recent election results where economic concerns were prominent. While Trump claims other nations bear tariff costs, Democrats view this as an admission of harm to American shoppers.

title: Ashes Test: Massive blow to Australia! Key player ruled out of the 1st Test
content: Josh Hazlewood will miss the first Ashes Test due to a hamstring injury. Michael Neser has been added to the squad. Sean Abbott also suffered a hamstring injury. The first Test begins on November 21. The Australian squad includes Steve Smith as captain. England will be led by Ben Stokes.

title: IPL: Shastri reveals truth behind Jadeja‚Äôs CSK exit - claims 'he always knew'
content: Ravindra Jadeja is set for a major IPL transfer. He is expected to join Rajasthan Royals from Chennai Super Kings. This move marks the end of a long association with CSK. Jadeja has navigated captaincy changes and crowd reactions. Former coach Ravi Shastri believes external noise will not affect his focus. Jadeja remains a top-class cricketer with proven performances.

title: Rajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa blessed with baby girl on fourth wedding anniversary
content: Bollywood actors Rajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa have welcomed their first child, a baby girl. The happy news arrived on their fourth wedding anniversary, November 15. The couple shared their joy online, calling their daughter God's greatest blessing. Friends and celebrities have sent warm congratulations. This marks a new chapter for the couple, who first met on the sets of 'Citylights'.

title: Deal done! Samson joins CSK‚Äîall you need to know about this trade
content: Chennai Super Kings and Rajasthan Royals have finalized a significant player trade. Ravindra Jadeja will now play for Rajasthan Royals, while Sanju Samson moves to Chennai Super Kings. This deal involves star players and has been approved by the BCCI. An official announcement is expected soon. Both players have agreed to the move.

title: 'No discussion at... ': SA coach reacts to Bumrah's controversial 'bauna' remark
content: South Africa will not pursue the stump-mic incident from the first Test, with batting coach Ashwell Prince dismissing it as a non-issue. The remark, overheard during an appeal involving Temba Bavuma, sparked online debate.  Jasprit Bumrah's exceptional bowling, taking 5/27, dominated the day, reducing South Africa to 159 all out. India ended at 37/1, setting up a compelling second day.

title: Rahul Gandhi meets Kharge to discuss Congress Bihar poll drubbing, party asserts ‚Äòvote chori‚Äô charge
content: The leaders met to discuss the Congress' poor performance in Bihar, where the party won only six of the 61 seats it contested, its second-worst show in the State after 2010, when it won only four seats

title: Uttar Pradesh Government moves to withdraw charges against Dadri lynching accused
content: The Assistant District Government Counsel, Gautam Buddha Nagar, Bhag Singh Bhati acted on the directions of the State Government through a letter dated August 26, 2025

content: Chirag Paswan said he congratulated Nitish Kumar for resounding victory of the NDA and discussed next government formation

title: Kerala local body polls: Outgoing Mayor Arya Rajendran‚Äôs absence from the fray, governance record dominate Thiruvananthapuram Corporation campaign
content: CPI(M)‚Äôs surprise decision to upend ageing and established political power structures in Thiruvananthapuram Corporation in 2021 by nominating Arya Rajendran as Mayor arguably appears to have prompted Congress and BJP as well to experiment with comparable dramatic turns in candidate announcement in 2025

title: Dharwad ZP CEO directs officials to expedite work on multi-village drinking water supply project
content: The project to supply drinking water to 388 villages in Dharwad district is being implemented in DBOT mode

title: IndiGo, Akasa Air to commence flight operations from Navi Mumbai airport on December 25
content: IndiGo said it will connect the future-ready airport to ten cities across India including Delhi, Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Ahmedabad, Lucknow, North Goa (Mopa), Jaipur, Nagpur, Cochin, and Mangalore, starting December 25

title: Indian Army‚Äôs Gajraj Corps develops high-altitude monorail in Arunachal Pradesh
content: The in-house High Altitude Monorail System will support operations at 16,000 feet in the Kameng Himalayas of Arunachal Pradesh

title: Punjab government suspends SSP for 'failing' to act against gangsters
content: No laxity of any kind will be tolerated in action against gangsters, says Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann

content: ‚ÄúThe cadre have been handed over to police for further legal formalities and rehabilitation procedures as per established norms,‚Äù an official report said

content: Mumbai-Ahmedabad High-Speed Rail Corridor spans approximately 508 km, covering 352 km in Gujarat and Dadra and Nagar Haveli, and 156 km in Maharashtra

title: First albino Asian water snake recorded in Assam
content: Albinism is an extremely rare genetic trait in wild snakes, characterised by the absence of melanin pigment

title: NIA arrests youth from West Bengal‚Äôs Uttar Dinajpur for alleged links with terror outfits
content: The youth was picked up from Sujapur area of the district on Friday (November 15) morning on suspicion of alleged terror links by sleuths of the NIA, he said

title: ‚ÄòAnti-conversion‚Äô law: Arunachal Pradesh appoints head of panel to examine draft rules
content: The Gauhati High Court had in September 2024 ordered the State Government to finalise the rules for implementing the Arunachal Pradesh Freedom of Religion Act of 1978

title: Explosives recovered from Faridabad transported to Nowgam police station in air-tight containers over past two days, says official
content: The explosives were being packed in small bags and were to be transported to Forensic Sciences Laboratory (FSL) in Jammu when the ‚Äúaccidental explosion‚Äù occurred on November 14 at 11.22 pm, the official said

title: Police book 12 for illegally selling government land earmarked for cemetery in Bhiwandi

title: As school-college tour season begins, Kerala MVD launches crackdown on tourist buses using illegal lights and sound systems
content: MVD has instructed school and college authorities to share details of tourist buses they charter for field trips so that inspectors can examine the vehicles before the journey

title: India calls for greater transparency in functioning of UNSC subsidiary organs
content: Ambassador Parvathaneni Harish underscored the need for greater transparency in the functioning of the subsidiary organs

content: A huge quantity of explosive substances recovered from Faridabad were kept securely in an open area and were to be forwarded to the forensic lab, the J&K DGP said

title: ‚ÄòNo faith in Crime Branch,‚Äô says Goa AAP, demands judicial inquiry into cash-for-jobs scam
content: ‚ÄúThe Minister should immediately step down for an impartial investigation into the case. We have no faith in the Crime Branch. There should be a judicial inquiry into the case,‚Äù says Goa AAP president Amit Palekar

title: Kerala man removes fuses of transformers after power to his house cut

title: Kerala local body polls 2025:¬†Keen battle on the cards in Perumbavoor as UDF, LDF eye stability
content: While the Congress-led UDF exudes optimism that it would retain power with an improved majority, the CPI(M)-led LDF is hopeful of wresting power in the municipality. The BJP, which has four members in the outgoing council, is eyeing to double its tally this time

title: Kerala local body polls 2025:¬†AAP to contest in over 400 panchayats and four Corporations
content: The anti-corruption movement-turned-political outfit has just one elected ward member in Kerala‚ÄîBeena Kurian from Karinkunnam panchayat in Thodupuzha taluk of Idukki district. The AAP will field candidates in all 14 districts, though not in every local body

title: Massive fire in central Kolkata building; 20 fire engines rushed to spot, no casualties reported
content: Operation is still underway to douse blaze which erupted around 5.30 am on Saturday (November 15); Local councillor said buildings had no proper fire safety measures

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: No need to be a people‚Äôs representative to intervene in people‚Äôs issues, says Mayor Arya Rajendran
content: The outgoing Thiruvananthapuram Mayor is in the thick of electioneering, despite not being a candidate this time. In an interview with The Hindu, she says it is for the party to decide who has to carry out various responsibilities based on political situations

title: Three drown, one missing after car falls into dam in Jharkhand
content: Initial investigation suggests that the driver lost control over the car and the vehicle overturned before falling into the water body

title: Kerala local body polls 2025:  Central Travancore in focus as Kerala Congress seeks to become a tangible political power
content: The party has managed to hold on to almost the same number of seats it contested last time. However, only a strong showing in upcoming polls will allow the party to maintain its leverage at the bargaining table. Performance on the ground is now the currency that will define the influence of the Kerala Congress in the UDF

title: Delhi car blast: Doctors with bombs
content: On the evening of November 10, an explosion in a car near the Red Fort in Delhi killed 13 people and injured at least 20. Investigations suggest that the suspect, Dr. Umar ul Nabi, who died in the blast, was part of a network that was allegedly plotting terror strikes. Nine people, some of them doctors, have been arrested.¬†Vijaita Singh¬†and¬†Alisha Dutta¬†report on the tragedy in the national capital and the findings of the investigation

content: Sivapriya, who had a normal delivery on October 22 at SAT hospital, was discharged on October 24 and had been re-admitted with high fever, diarrhoea and in a state of septic shock on October 26th evening. Her death following sepsis on November 5 triggered allegation that the infection was hospital-acquired

content: if any of these thoughts come true, don't be surprised . he is off to a fantastic start, averaging 25.4 PPG, 7.2 RPG and 6.2 APG through 11 games . his numbers fell in most categories and he finished outside the top 50 in fantasy scoring .

content: 71.6% women, nearly 9 percentage points more than men (62.8%) turned up to vote this time - up from 59.7% in 2020 . women voters in Bihar are partial to Nitish Kumar-led govt for its pro-women policies .

title: Election results: This Kishor can‚Äôt sing; Bihar tunes out PK
content: prashant Kishor dominated headlines because of his communication skills . he promised to deliver the state from the woes of unemployment and unceasing 'palayan' (migration) he worked with leading politicians, including PM Narendra Modi, and a host of regional heavyweights .

title: Bihar election results: PM Modi hails 'sushasan ki jeet'; hints at Nitish staying CM
content:
NEW DELHI: PM Modi termed NDA's landslide performance as "sushasan ki jeet (victory of good governance)", in what was seen as an endorsement of the continuation of Nitish Kumar as CM. Nitish is popular among his followers as "Sushasan Babu", claiming to have effected a turnaround in the past 20 years by improving law and order, and development. "Victory of development has been achieved. Victory of the spirit of public welfare has been achieved. Victory of social justice has been achieved," Modi posted on X.

‚ÄòBihar‚Äôs New MY Formula Is Mahila & Youth‚Äô: PM Modi Targets RJD-Congress After NDA‚Äôs Landslide Win

"I congratulate all NDA leaders for their wonderful work and CM Nitish Kumar for his leadership," Modi said, allaying apprehensions about Nitish's continuation as CM even as BJP emerged as the single largest party. The opposition had claimed that BJP would not reappoint Nitish as CM. Also read: With promises & warnings, Shah turned around 'aggrieved souls'

End of Article

title: Election results 2025: Spirit of giving? Bihar may need a stiff shot of booze revenue
content: bihar's finance department will have to pull out the spreadsheets to redo the fiscal arithmetic . the government will need to raise resources to not just meet the big promises made in the NDA manifesto, including more money to the 74 lakh farmers, SC students and others in the state . there is chatter of a review of prohibition imposed by Nitish Kumar in 2016 .

He has been covering Parliament since 2003 to see how politics shaped up domestic policy and India‚Äôs position at global platform.
